p: This review focuses on how obesity and cardiovascular disease impact influenza response. Retrospective studies demonstrate that during the 2009 H1N1 pandemic, obesity was identified as a risk factor for hospitalization, mechanical ventilation, and mortality upon infection. These data must be highlighted since it is projected that nearly 50% of the worldwide population is going to be obese by 2050. Several case studies have identified possible effects of obesity on viral replication in the deep lung, progression to viral pneumonia, and prolonged viral shedding [ 1]. Therefore, management of the influenza infection in this at-risk population has to have special consideration given that they may not respond optimally to vaccination [ 2].
